runs.comm: first ball! Chopped on. Back of a length, just outside off, Smith shaping to angled the ball away and it takes the bottom edge into the stumps
full outside off, nice shape way from Samuels, left alone
good length outside off, left alone again
back of a length, on off stump, defended to backward point
this one nips back in around off stump, pushed to midwicket and he wanted a single but Dernbach was quickly across
a maiden! Outside off, defended with soft hands towards point. That was a very classy over from Dernbach. He's often criticised; deserves much praise there
angled into the pads, clipped down to fine leg
adjusts his line, outside off, quite wide, left alone
and another! Charles trying to turn a length ball into the leg side and gets a fat leading edge that loops straight up in the air, giving Jordan loads of time to settle under the catch
an appeal for a catch down the leg side, but that clipped the pad through to Buttler
good delivery, nips back from a good length and strikes Simmons high on the pads
close! Drives at a full ball, not to the pitch, gets an inside edge past the stumps and it runs towards fine leg
he isn't defending this one, heaves a length delivery over mid-on...moved his front leg to open the stance
crunch! Wow, that's power. Stepping to leg again and he drills a drive through the covers. To the boundary before any blinked
touch shorter, not offering width, played into the pitch and it runs to point
back of a length, aiming another drive through the covers but he clothes it to mid-off
edged! No slips now and it races down to third man. Think Samuels opened the face, so skill involved
almost a catch! Samuels aims to go straight down the ground, doesn't get the distance and the ball hangs in the air but Morgan can't quite get around from mid-off
round the wicket, angled into leg stump, driven down to long-off.
comes down the pitch, chips this in the air but short of mid-on who is on the edge of the circle
goes back to cut a slightly shorter ball, picks out cover
comes forward and defends
dragged down short, he rocks back and drives this past cover...no cover in the deep
tossed up a fuller, he leans forward and places it down to long-off
angled into the pads, bobbles square of the wicket
another drag on! Given himself room against a back of a length delivery to leg then gets a bottom edge into leg stump
good length outside off, punched to cover
tight on off stump, defended to the leg side
just a fraction fuller, Bravo lofts it over long-on. The bat closed in his hand so it lost a little of the timing, otherwise might have been six
shuffles to off stump, tucks into midwicket
round the wicket, full at leg stump, tucked to midwicket
short of a length, driven into the pitch and it goes to cover
fuller this time, leans forward and plays with an open face...nice start from Tredwell
on leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
stretches forward and works this towards mid-on
another dot ball to end with as this is nudged towards mid-on
full and pushed back to the bowler
that's well struck, goes down on his back knee to a ball that's the perfect length to slog sweep and he clears deep midwicket
that's a good comeback, held this one back a fraction, drifts into the pads and runs to short fine-leg
full at leg stump, clipped off his toes to long-on
straight delivery, flicked through square leg
worked off the back foot into midwicket, Simmons sets off wanting a couple but decides against it
gets a think inside edge to the leg side
drives with a flourish through the off side, placed wide of Jordan on the cover boundary
on middle, opens the face to short third man
goes back to cut and gets beaten
goes across the crease and tickles this fine fine past the keeper...in fact, it takes the pad rather than bat
full outside leg, prodded back to the bowler...again excellent over from Tredwell
onto the back foot and pushed through midwicket
works across the line, flicked from middle and off to deep square
driven down the ground to long-on
dragged down short, only costs a single as he drives to deep cover
nicely bowled, Simmons uses his feet but Parry fires it in towards leg stump and it takes the pads
gets the line wrong this time, width outside off but Simmons also used the crease well to engineer the shot as he cut behind square
can't beat midwicket
stands outside leg stump and effortlessly flicks this delivery over deep midwicket
short, this time he rocks back and goes through cover
full on off stump, comes forward and defends
outside leg stump, plays the sweep and gets it very fine off the bottom edge
better line from Tredwell, back on off stump, pushed the off side and Buttler scampers from behind the stumps
short first up, Bravo pulls but finds short fine-leg

brilliant catch! What a day Jordan is having. Short again from Bopara, Bravo picked it up with a one-legged pull, it looked to be heading the boundary but Jordan ran to his right from deep midwicket then put in a dive to pluck out the catch.
back of a length, aims to the leg side but comes off a leading edge back towards Bopara
slower ball, dragged down short, pulled along the ground to Jordan in the deep
defended to the off side
an ugly heave across the line and it's five down. Back of a length small, he was trying to smear it over the leg side and the ball went straight up towards cover instead. Poor batting.
pushed to point
uses his feet, flicks it wide of Tredwell in his followthrough to long-on
touch shorter outside off but he can only cut to backward point
worked square into the leg side
back of a length, pushed to the bowler
goes for the sweep, gets a healthy top edge which loops over short fine-leg
full and driven to mid-off who is inside the circle
short and pulled to long-on
finds the gap this time, and with the distance. A short ball which is pulled in front of square. Sat up nicely for the shot
pulled to short fine leg
almost cut out of the keeper's gloves, gets it fine of short third-man
and more excellent placement, a more authentic cut shot this time which goes squarer through point. Just the over West Indies needed.
leading edge...but doesn't carry to point. Working across the line, the ball turned a fraction
that's a much better shot, down the pitch and drives inside out over extra cover, wide of long-off
pulls and short ball and it almost carries to deep square, goes one bounce in the end
quicker, flatter and follows the batsman towards leg stump, worked into the leg side
touch more air, Ramdin spotted that and went for the slog sweep but picked out deep midwicket
shortish delivery, cut out to the cover sweeper
cuts and misses
angled into the pads, swung away to deep square-leg
close to find the gap, cuts again but Moeen dives at point to stop it one-handed
back of a length, he splices his pull which dribbles to long-on
cut out to the cover sweeper...England delighted with singles
swing and miss, aiming to send this length delivery into (or over) the stands at long-on. Good comeback from Bopara after expensive previous over.
neat stroke, flicked off the stumps behind square and the ball is racing towards the boundary before Hales gets around to pull off an excellent flick-back
back of a length, swings hard but just gets a bottom edge which stops dead by his feet
slower ball, back of a length, Ramdin spotted it very early, sat back in the crease then pulled through midwicket
shoved down the leg side...useful extra ball for West Indies
low full toss, might have slipped a little, heaved out to deep square...could have been worse (or better, depending on your view)
brilliant, inventive, classy...moves across the stumps and scoops a full delivery over short fine-leg to reach his half-century. Giving his team a chance.
started to move to leg, then was back in a more conventional position...after all that, it clips the pad to the leg side
full outside off, slashes away over cover and it speeds past the sweeper before he's barely had time to move
good comeback, lovely slower ball, beats Simmons who is way to early...close to hitting the stumps. Back-of-the-hand, delivery
phew...he'll breath a sigh of relief there, this was sliced powerful but straight to Tredwell at backward point
swings a length ball to the leg side, another slower ball
connects with this one, it's high over midwicket and drops into the first tier of seating. Picked the slower ball, and got the required distance
full outside off, driven to deep cover so he keeps the strike
short of a length, cut in the air through point and Jordan does well to keep them to a single from deep cover although the running wasn't great
finds the gap! Short delivery, pulled away and it just evades Morgan who ran around and dived from deep midwicket
short again, leg side again, this time not off the middle as he finds long-on
slash and miss! Precious dot ball. Aiming to cut. Good take from Buttler
angled into the body, he misses out on the pull and it doesn't connect with anything
keeping it back of a length, flogged down to long-on
well bowled, straight yorker, drilled to long-on
low full toss, clubbed down the ground one bounce to long-on...good start to the over for Jordan
inside edge! It was almost the perfect yorker. Such are the margins. It took the edge and flew past the keeper
leg stump! Jordan, who else? Holds his nerve, it wasn't actually the yorker this time. A length delivery, perhaps held back a touch, Ramdin swings across the line and misses
first ball! Four to third man. Short of a length outside, gets over the top of the ball and back-cuts fine of short third man
bouncer over leg stump, called wide! England can't believe that. Fair call from square leg umpire. Was over Sammy's head in his normal stance.
short on the hip, beats fine leg! The Barbados crowd are jumping. What noise. Sammy just helped this delivery away with a roll of the wrists, the placement was ideal
over the off side! Short of a length, sliced over cover but long-off is able to get around
full, outside leg, slower ball, slugs a single to deep midwicket

chaos! It's all going off. Where do I start?! It was a superb bounce, first up, from Dernbach which hits Sammy in the chest. He sets off for a run, Dernbach chases from cover then throws at the non-striker's stumps with no one there. They try to steal an overthrow, but the return comes in and Morgan is at the stumps this time.
nailed it! Flat six. Sammy is pumped. Was another bouncer from Dernbach and he creamed it over deep square-leg
oh, what a time to send down a slower ball. It's full outside off, Sammy is early and can't reach it
it's a wide! Would you believe it. Outside off, Sammy flashed. Buttler clapped. Then the umpire stretched is arms out. Tight call on first glance
that would have been a wide, too! But Sammy gets bat on it! Even wider outside off than the last delivery. The ball dribbles to short third-man and England have won.
